multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: inflation; Apple iPhone 17 price hikes from tariffs may push US inflation higher, potentially prompting Fed policy tightening.

category.motivation: The article reports on Apple’s upcoming product launch, pricing changes, and new hardware features, which constitutes a company update rather than earnings, policy, or macro data.

impact.motivation: Rumored iPhone 17 launch could affect Apple’s equity performance and, by extension, the S&P 500, but the unconfirmed nature of the details limits the certainty of the impact.

time_frame.motivation: The article reports a specific upcoming product launch event that will directly influence Apple’s near‑term earnings and stock price.

article_node.title: Apple iPhone 17 launch date is rumored for September: Everything to know about the newest lineup
article_node.summary: Apple is set to unveil the iPhone 17 lineup on September 9, 2025, with rumors of a slimmer iPhone 17 Air, a new A19 chip, a single‑lens camera, and a potential $50 price hike across the range. Leaks suggest the Air will be ultra‑thin, use a titanium frame, and feature a 2,800 mAh battery, while the Pro models may switch to aluminum and include a full‑width camera island. The event may also showcase new Apple Watch models, AirPods Pro 3, and iOS 26 with Liquid Glass design and AI features. Pricing could rise by $50 across the lineup, with storage bump to 256 GB for the Pro. The rumored event date is Tuesday, September 9, with pre‑orders starting the following Friday.
